all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Automation. Segmentation Feature. Bright Future!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Powerful automation and segmentation features and bright future as I see great potential for Encharge to grow and close gaps between them and big names in ESP/ email marketing automation platforms out there.

I am currently using one of the most powerful, if not the most powerful, email marketing platforms. So I am very familiar with segmentation and personalization features that Encharge has and can help them shape their future growth. Happy to see them welcoming our feature requests, including WooCommerce and/or Shopify integrations, forms, "Action-Goal" for the Flow builder, among others.

- Dashboard is clean with all the key metrics like subscriber growth, opens, clicks, replies, unsubscribes, spam complaints, etc charts

- Nice touch of automatically importing your website logo if you enter your website link during your account sign up

- Integrations: tons of them already there, plus Webhook, Zapier, MailChimp, ManyChat, BotStar, to name a few

- Email Builder has two options: drag and drop builder with text, images, social media icons, etc. and text-only option. Several templates are available to give you a jumpstart. They are working on a text editor that would allow inserting images as well. But the drag and drop builder takes care of it anyways.

- Automatic Email validation. Say what!

- Visual Flow builder that is drag and drop of modules/steps like triggers, actions, and Filters

- Folder structure for Flows, Emails, and Broadcasts

- Segmentation: a couple of default segments is a nice touch to give you ideas and to help your brain start thinking of strategies and use cases.

- Email Metric section gives you a view of various email metrics used in a specific (or All) Flow(s) and then for a particular email in those Flows in a particular timeframe.

- Deliverability is high as claimed by Encharge. Time will tell, but I feel confident and certainly hope that is the case once I start using it.

Support: Fast response in the app and via email as well as in their Facebook group

I did a quick video review, more like an overview of the app. Check it out here: https://youtu.be/Vs6VHhQlH1M

https://youtu.be/Vs6VHhQlH1M

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There's nothing to dislike per se at the moment except I would like them to add a bunch of features, for example:

1. WooCommerce Integration
2. Shopify Integration
3. ThriveCart Integration
4. AccessAlly Integration
5. Broadcast Resend feature including scheduling options
6. Broadcast Metrics (This may be there already, but I don't remember.
7. CTA Button and Image insertion in the Text-Based emails
8. Wait Until Specific Date trigger
9. GOAL Action/Trigger

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge solves the automation, segmentation, and personalization challenges. For Agency clients, there is a sub-account feature with a separate tracking script and account management. It also has an automatic email validation feature for subscriber opt-ins saving time and money.

all_reviews.review_title: A sophisticated marketing tool with a great user experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
With a great UX/UI and visual builder, setting up flows and navigating Encharge is a pleasure.

Advanced user segmentation based on customer behavior keep the emails highly relevant driving user engagement which increases revenue. Campaigns run smoothly and have great deliverability too.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
We are leaning into ecommerce and are always looking for cost effective replacements for the 800 lb gorillas in the space.

The initial focus at Encharge has been on advanced integrations and event based tracking for marketers and SAAS companies but ecommerce is currently on their roadmap and under dev.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge stormed onto the scene and is quickly gaining traction and stealing thunder from the old standards. We are always looking for ways to drive user engagement, increase deliverability and push ROI.  Although Enchagre is fresh out of the gate, they have very sophisticated features with great pricing plans.

all_reviews.review_title: Great alternative to Activecampaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I liked the excellent onboarding process for someone new to a new platform. The UI is up to date, and I've already been trying to create flows, and the drag and drop feature makes it easy. With the recent integration of Botstar, I found more uses for this. I don't know what to do with all the data I'm getting because all of these can be used to trigger. It's a good saas product for those who want to try a new way of automating emails. I've currently imported more than 700 contacts and it imported well without hiccups. The seemless webook integration for getting data through the forms is what I really like too. I had to lookup on how webhook works through their knowledge base. Talking about knowledgebase, there are almost a hundred articles to guide me.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
You'll have to make sure that you get the segment correct by getting the filters right. I also hope that there would be more email templates prepared for someone new to email marketing. The current HTML email templates are very simple. I can't wait for the certain date trigger so that I'll be able to send emails for birthdays & anniversaries! I hope there's a way to know a rough date when the roadmap would be fulfilled.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Get their growth plan first

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing automation, confirmation emails, event-based marketing automation for our school

all_reviews.review_content:

This product is incredibly easy to use and the team sets you up so well. From the get go, they send you emails to guide you along. Then, if they notice you started using a feature then stopped, or did not complete a process, they'll reach out to you to make sure everything is ok and ask if you need anything.
Initially, I had issues getting setup, likely due to problem of my own. I reached out to them for support and was followed up with very quickly. I highly recommend this to people considering it. You'll definitely be taken care of.
I've already reached out to friends and gotten them hooked!

nothing i can think of, honestly. It has met every need so far.

Everything is good, and the roadmap is also promising. I love it 100%

all_reviews.review_title: Loving Encharge
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
They have a great, great UI, and I love that they have template automations to attain particular objectives (this is a brilliant idea that I hadn't seen in other SaaS products!).

What do you dislike about Encharge?
They are a new SaaS platform, so obviously they have a long way to go before they consolidate as a leader in the behavioural email SaaS world. Main area they should focus on: native integrations with essential services. In their roadmap, it seems they're contemplating integrations with what I personally need (mainly, Google Sheets). So, I trust that the team will move forward fast with new features and native integrations. They do, however, integrate with Zapier and Integrately, so if you're happy using those services, then you shouldn't have a problem. But, for me, native integrations with at least essential services like Google Sheets is a must for any e-mail SaaS.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge helps you reduce your CHURN rate, basically. That's how I will use this powerful app.

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge your marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Drag and drop builder, segmentation, automated drip campaigns, user action based responses via set triggers, integration with other apps.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
the ui feels a bit old, while it works fine maybe it can have a visual upgrade. The wait block in automation uses timezone of the user which can get tricky at times.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I recently launched some courses and was looking for email automation so that I can acitvely engage with my customers. That was solved with encharge.

Encharge allows you to trigger automated marketing campaigns for your customers. It lets you target your customers based on their behavior or tags--all without writing a single line of code.

You can easily build campaigns with custom email content. Emails get automatically sent out and the customer gets tagged into the right segments basis their interaction in the email. Automation rules are built via drag and drop builder for easy setup and fast activation. I used it first time for my online training sessions and the analytics helped me change my approach of how emails were being written to the customers, it also has A/B testing.

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge is a POWERFUL Email Automation Tool!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Here are some reasons why Encharge is a pretty solid tool:
1. It offers unlimited emails, unlimited automation flows, unlimited broadcast emails on all their levels, plans.
2. They use SendGrid and AWS - the email deliverability is seamless and fast with this robust infrastructure in place.
3. UI/UX is simple and intuitive. We hardly have the need to look at their help or knowledge base docs.
4. Integrations - they already offer integrations with other tools like the Swipe Pages, Facebook which is relevant in my situation. But their growing list of integrations planned (on their roadmap)  is promising and I really look forward to using Encharge for many years to come!

What do you dislike about Encharge?
1. The metrics page shows the numbers but we cannot dig down deep yet. For example, I can see the number of clicks, opens, delivers, bounces but cannot see exactly directly from the Metrics page. Although, we can see these data individually on the People section at an individual level.
2. Emails - list view is needed. At present their email templates show up as huge thumbnails with a quick preview but I would love to see a list view with all the associated metrics.
3. Emails are inter-usable between flows. But that's a caveat in my humble opinion when we use and 'edit' the same email that is delivered in different flows - it affects other flows too. So this should either be not allowed or an alert has to be in place to let users know that editing an email will affect its other linked flows.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Save time, automate email deliveries, send drip content, engage with email subscribers easily.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing tool for marketers and creators!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge is excellent for creating specific flows for growing your email lists (in my case) and managing your leads in ways that I couldn't do it before. I was a Sendfox user, and while it was great for sending emails, it didn't have the automation tools and integrations that Encharge offers, you can connect with platforms like Zapier or Pabbly to create complex processes to grow and nurture your leads.

For me, that only is more than worth the price. It's difficult to find tools this easy to use and powerful and on a reasonable price.

One of the best tools I've used over the last year, I recommend it for marketers and platforms alike. They have a great set of tools that will help any kind of online marketer.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
They really need to add integrations for platforms like woocommerce and WordPress, you can actually receive leads from these platforms, but the amount of info you can get from them is limited to the forms you've added to your site. No data is coming directly from Woocommerce or WordPress.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
If you want a real ActiveCampaing alternative, encharge is perffect for you.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Landing pages automation and leads nurturing. Primarily I use it to create flows on different landing pages to segment my potential clients in various categories.

all_reviews.review_title: A serious bit of email marketing automation kit...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The first thing you'll note is just how easy it is to get up and running with Encharge. The UX/UI is intuitive, and, unlike other email-based automation tools, everything you need is not more than two clicks away. Very well thought out 

What drew me to Encharge was the number of inbuilt 3rd party integrations, making set up email automation flows a cinch.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There are no CONS I can truly think of for now except that I'm holding off on moving all my contacts and client contacts until I test their deliverability. But that's not a CON, just a precaution I am personally taking.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
You want to add people who open an email to a custom audience on Facebook? No problem. How about sending a special discount to contacts who view a product more than 5 times but have yet to buy? You got it.

Yes you can do this is in other email automation apps but you'll probably need to leverage a tool like Zapier or Integrately to make it happen... with Encharge it's all there.

all_reviews.review_title: Finally an email automation software which is easy to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I like that it merges many independent 3rd party apps, that I needed to accomplish the same tasks previously.
It is very helpful that it displays how many people were in a flow step and how many people still are in a flow step; which not only gives a great bird's eye view but it also helps troubleshoot flows when testing at the beginning.
The Daily dashboard gives me a great overview of the day's activity

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There isn't too much I dislike at this point.
If I were to add one thing, it would be to have a built-in form capability. While it certainly isn't a show stopper as many tools accomplish this today. After speaking to their support, they have indicated they will review adding it to their roadmap.
If I was to be really picky it would be great to have some broadcast email templates for different seasons and holidays that we could just leverage with little editing of our own.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing all customer lead touchpoints into a single location.
It took a couple of days to piece everything together but it has been a dream to work with from that point on. Now we are looking at how we can proactively stay on top of customer communications.
We look forward to using the automation tools to the max.

all_reviews.review_title: A Feature rich yet affordable Marketing Automation Solution for Small Businessess
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Wow, I'm impressed by Encharge! I was using Active Campaign for a long time and was mighty impressed by the automation capabilities. Discovered Encharge through a friend's recommendation and oh boy, it didn't disappoint.

The flow builder is amazing, simple and powerful UI. Lead scoring feature and direct integration with facebook to create custom audience is amazing. Generally its a high tire and premium feature in most marketing automation tools.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The native integration with LeadPages (landing page builder) is currently missing. I hope they will add more more integrations in the future, and this issue will be sorted. Currently have to depend on third party connectors like Zapier and Pabbly to get the job done.

The other area I'm watching out for is the email deliverability. Active Campaign is known for its email deliverability, so waiting to see how Encharge delivers on this; if Encharge delivers on this expectation then migrating from Active Campaign will be a no brainer.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
The feature of lead scoring and the native integration with facebook to create custom audience is super powerful. This is something I was eyeing for but is a premium and high ticket feature in most automation software. I am impressed by the value for money given the features provided by Encharge.

all_reviews.review_title: An outstanding email automation app from any angle you look at it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
These guys really pay attention to detail. It starts with the on-boarding video walk-through when you first login. The UI/UX is clean and intuitive. The knowledge base is comprehensive and addresses every imaginable question. And if you ever need help, their help desk is responsive.

This is a feature-rich email automation app that matches up well against the established big boys.

There are many native integrations, with the two most important ones being Webhooks and Zapier allowing Encharge to connect to practically any app your heart desires.

The strength of Encharge is that it specializes in behavioral-based email automation. Putting your email in front of the right person, at the right time, with the right message. This is the future of email, and with Encharge you will ensure you won't be left behind.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There isn't much to complain about, but if I had to pick one thing it would be that I would like to see more video tutorials.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was looking to switch from Aweber to a more robust email automation app.

all_reviews.review_title: My Experience With Encharge so far
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Plenty of ready-made templates to start with, for me it was very easy to begin utilizing "Capture Leads with Lead Magnet and send out Support Sequence" one, but I was under the impression that the Encharge team created the templates just to give me the first step and then the limit is the sky, I believe Encharge users will feel the same too. Great stuff all around this platform with unlimited emails!, this is insane!, Encharge not only created a magnificent product but they also impressed with the "guiding our customers" mentality while working in the UI/UX.  This is a big certainly a big motivation to avoid unnecessary huge monthly bills from similar product with less features!.

I was very pleased to see their deal in Appsumo

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There is nothing that I didn't like, however, since this is a new product in the market then we have to wait for more integration to come which is mentioned in their roadmap.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Don't miss the LTD deal in Appsumo, this product is all that you need for your email marketing

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I believe having a look at my experience will explain the number of problem Encharge is solving for my business to grow, stay focused and avoid wasting time.

I signed up, finished the procedure, logged in and I was welcomed to a first onboarding page with a brief video introduction to walking me through the Encharge with ease-in experience.

It is an excellent impression. A lot of SaaS tools skip this part of an educational and good onboarding experience of the product in action which leads to lots of confusion and therefore more load on the support team. The comprehensive walkthrough is quite extensive with all the attributes covered and offers a fair suggestion of the item all at once.
Then comes the page to start importing my contact with 2 options and their samples! great. You can either import Excel or CSV data with relevant headers.
In addition to that, you have more possibilities while importing the contacts, fields, tags, etc. which makes it very valuable if you have already established a lot of tags for your contacts and listings in your existing CRM solution or any other email marketing automation app.

The next step is to connect your contact with so many application "Natively" if you want to use it together with Encharge, it's all about your marketing strategy and how you get used to working or your client used to your marketing style.
For me the native integration with MailChimp, Slack as well as HubSpot were the ones I was looking for, however, I was additionally excited with the Webhook's abilities and the availability of a lot of the platforms and tools that I can connect to Encharge.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I love the ability to tag and send sequences for each of our customers.  We have different plans and treating everyone the same with the same email blasts makes no sense at all.  Now we can create a customer journey to tell our brand story and automate it.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The hard part about a software like this is you have to have your ducks in a row..  It's taking awhile to think through and implement.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to make each customer feel like they are a part of the brand.  If they are new they get targeted messages about our brand, if they are loyal customers they get special treatment but not general info about the brand because they already know that stuff.  It makes it more personal and easier to build a tribe.

all_reviews.review_content:

It's easy to get started. As soon as I opened the app, it's clear what to do.
The getting started wizard is helpful in this regard too.
Feature-wise I have not had the time to test all of it out yet, but I see some things are (at the time of writing) still in development. That is a good thing,because of it I might get to be part of the journey, and may also be influencing what the final result will become.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I would like to easier connect to other services. Perhaps an API to create custom integration could be a great addition to integrate other services. Maybe this is part of the upcoming features. Only time will tell.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Connecting to customers with email is very time-consuming. As I'm working as a freelancer, I really need to use as little time as possible on tedious tasks and things that don't immediately bring in money.

all_reviews.review_title: If you own a Saas you need this
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Let me start first with the ease of use, everything is very intuitive, you don't really need any complex onboarding or anything similar.

The most powerful feature for any saas owner is the ingest API, with just a few lines of code you can send your most important events to encharge, not just your users, but their actions inside your software including all the properties for those actions and then you can create very specific segments of people.

From those segments you can create flows that are extremely easy to setup.

I can go very granular on those segments, people using a specific feature, on a certain timeframe, with some very specific characteristics, you name it.

Do yourself a favor and test encharge.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I'm really liking everything, there are some features missing but the team is very responsive and they are already on their roadmap.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Signup for a trial and test it yourself

Create granular segments of my users

all_reviews.review_title: Great email marketing automation platform for everything you need as a startup
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge has a very clean interface and a dashboard that makes it easy to navigate and learn. Automation capabilities are robust and capable with all new Visual Flow Automations Builder helping you clearly see how your automation will work. Compared to other solutions like Mailchimp or ActiveCampaign, I found Encharge more intuitive and simpler. I love that the software and the many different template options are available for mailings. I also like being able to easily change fonts, colors, backgrounds, and layouts. One of the best things here is it comes with a built-in email Verification feature.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Encharge does not have a free basic plan forever. Although they do offer a 14-day free trial. I think they should have a free plan for small businesses that are just starting out and can't afford to pay $ 49 a month. Other than that, for now, there are limited native triggers integrating with other tools, so it would be nice to have more native integration there. Encharge does not currently provide e-commerce integration, so it may not be a good choice for e-commerce industries.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall, this is a great platform for CRM, Marketing Automation, Email Marketing for a great price! Encharge has a very flexible pricing plan, where you only pay for as many contacts as you use (there is a price for 2000, 5000, 10000, 15000 and so on!) Choose Encharge after comparing with other tools like MailerLite, MailChimp, ActiveCampasign, etc. I really recommend it.

I can use less programs than before for designing and sending attractive email.

all_reviews.review_title: Automation game changer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
All I can say is that Encharge is a game changer! I have researched and tested many automated services available on the market, but each of them seems to fall short of my current and future needs. I needed a product that would expand with my business, and that's what I have found in Encharge. I love many things about the Encharge platform, such as the many integrations,  but what stood out for me is the ease of use right from the start. It's a very intuitive product (I believe even for the most novice user), and the support has been incredible. Creating an automation process without pulling my hair out is what made Encharge stand out from the rest.
I like to test how responsive the support team is when using their product because, let's face it, if you don't have the proper support, you will never be able to use a product the way you need to. The couple of times that I have reached out, the Encharge team has responded quickly and provided the right solution the first time. I have had a wonderful experience using Encharge, and I look forward to having Encharge as one of the main tools I use to continue to build my business. Now's the time to give Encharge a test drive.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Though there are many integrations I hope for more in the future like Thrive Cart

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Other platforms I have tested I have found to be very cumbersome when creating automation. Encharge's automation process is very easy to use and has saved me hours and hours of time spent trying to automate processes for my business. Encharge has allowed me to automate processes that will help me grow my businss.

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge.io Performs increasingly well!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge.io, although new to the market, is extremely powerful  regarding marketing automation, we use it to completely change the perception and the onboarding sequences for our subscribers based on their behaviors and their actions. Of course there is a margin for improvement (The assignment of tags is a bit counter-intuitive), but after a quick discussion with their support staff and with Kalo (the CEO), they told me that tag management is currently in the works :D Their support is brilliant and usually it does not take more than an hour to receive a response from their side. I like the possibilities, the usage of webhooks, the triggers and acrions, but most importantly their spirit and the effort they bring to continuously improve the tool, the delivery rate is flawless and monitored constantly.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
- They are lacking a tags management system which is already being addressed
- No Form Builder (Already being addressed as well)

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
You will have to understand that this is a brand new tool for email automation, but that they are improving it daily. It does quite a lot already.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it for Behavior based marketing campaigns, personalization is key in this market and the possibility to create tailor made campaigns is a must, the engagement is higher and ultimately so is the profit!

all_reviews.review_title: This is how email marketing automation should be
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The UI, user interface and did I mention the dashboard design. The UI is great, intuitive and very easy to use. The other competitor apps simply have bloated UI with too much unwanted information but Encharge shows us only what we need, at the right time, at the right place. It has everything that's needed for both beginners and professionals.

Onboarding was executed well by the Encharge's team as well. It was personalized, behavior-based and was a welcoming email.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Encharge is the new kid in the block so I'm worried if they'll keep all the features for the long term. Also, since it's new I don't yet know how good/bad their deliverability is. They say they're handing and monitoring the deliverability of the email through their proprietary system but only time will tell us whether their claim can be trusted or not.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're currently onboarding users who signup for UseOutreach with Encharge. The experience has been great so far. The main benefit is the time we saved by automating workflows on the go, at ease. Encharge is also a huge $$$ saver for us because we moved from ActiveCampaign.

all_reviews.review_title: Surprising about the whole package of features we got here
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Looking for a good time for a solution to help me stay in my clients mind, but without being that technical. Loved the flow building, very easy to set up and to customize.

Already voted for the Shopify and Woocommerce integration feature, since it will allow me to create even more segmented user bases. I played a little with the mail builder and created my first set of newsletters, really simple, beautiful designs, that's a plus for a solopreneur like me.

In the end, I finally found a substitute for my current Klavyio service and in soon it might be the main mail delivery system in my business.

Thanks so much for all the work put until now, and I'm looking positive towards the system future.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
As I said, I really need the Shopify integration and it concerns me a little when it will be available, so this is a point that I have my hands tied and need to wait their roadmap priorities.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating flows to segment my visitors with extremely detailed data, in am easy way.

all_reviews.review_title: A great product for marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I really like the built-in automation. The platform is easy to use and I don't need to use Integromat or other automation platforms to sync information.

I really liked how they have flow templates to get me going very fast.

The setup was very easy for me which was great. The platform is already connected to Amazon SES so that saves me the hassle of setting it up myself.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
For me, the number of contacts is a bit low but for most cases it should be fine. At the moment, they don't have landing pages or lead forms but I believe that will be coming in the future.

The downside to having it already connected to Amazon SES is that I don't have my own dedicated IP address. It isn't a dealbreaker but just something to point out.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
This is a great product to automate your email marketing and will save a lot of time and money when compared to Mailchimp or some of the other major platforms.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving manual process of lead-scoring contacts based on interactions

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for email
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
For some time I have been looking for an email tool that could offer me more features than just ordinary "auto-responders". When I had the opportunity to visit encharge.io, I was delighted at first sight.

What I liked most:
- The possibility of creating flows and programming triggers is fantastic;
- The user interface and experience are very intuitive and simple, which I like very much because it makes the process very objective;
- Possibility to configure the DNS parameters on the server, ensuring an excellent email delivery rate;

What do you dislike about Encharge?
- What I missed was native integration with Wordpress / Elementor, as most of my projects are developed on these platforms and using Zapier for this task is very costly. However, even with this small drawback, I believe in this project and decided to acquire the license because I consider encharge.io a very promising tool.
- I would love to have detailed information in the metrics area of   exactly which users opened or clicked on the messages, although this is possible using the filters.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge.io opens up a practically infinite range of possibilities for working with email campaigns with a better conversion rate. I am still studying and planning as I am growing more confident with this incredible tool. Recommended!

all_reviews.review_title: This Software is an Amazing Time Saver
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I love that Encharge has all the features I need in email marketing, such as segmentation, A/B testing, and workflows, but it also includes email validation and can trigger based on how people are interacting with my site. I was able to get my entire list moved over in minutes and setting up my flows has been straight forward and easy. Their service has also been top notch.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There are a few integrations that I would like to see happen, but they do have a roadmap and a feature request form so I can ask for what I need.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
The drag and drop builder makes Encharge easy and fast to use and set up. I also love that email validation is included, so I will no longer need to download my list and upload them to another app for validation.

all_reviews.review_title: Incredible tool for all level of marketing data reviewers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The data aspect is fantastic. I personally have an analytics background and am a data geek. My partners are not nearly as fascinated by data, but they have no trouble using Encharge and also see the immense value it provides. As a brand new company, we are learning as we go and marketing is definitely one of the weak spots of our team. Encharge has enabled us to analyze what works and what doesn't, about our customer behaviors, and so much more about our company's outward communications.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The factor I dislike the most is probably much more personal, but I wish the software had a dark mode. I guess that would fall under design/UI.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team doesn't have nearly as much marketing experience as we would like. Encharge has helped us catch up with some of our competitors by gaining valuable insights into our customer behaviors and how our outward communications are received.

all_reviews.review_title: Legit ActiveCampaign Contender
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Marketing automation power without the bloat like other SaaS companies. The UX and UI looks polished and feels great! The onboarding videos help speed up the learning curve (even though the learning curve is small). Also, being able to receive webhooks from other third-party services is terrific to integrate marketing data.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I'd like to see more native integrations with the third-party apps I use. Webhooks are working in the interim.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Improving conversion rates. It's great to be able to segment users based on their site behavior to send them a relevant message that will likely lead to a better user experience and conversion action. For example, a real use case is trying to improve abandon forms for my client. If a user abandons the form, I'm able to dynamically create an audience list on Facebook, change my offer on the website, and trigger follow-up email sequences to see how to help the user take a conversion action.

all_reviews.review_title: A real alternative to ActiveCampaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge is a marketing automation platform that allows you to reach very advanced levels of automation.
I especially like its drag and drop system to create flows. This system allows you to create complex automations in a very visual way.
The platform has a very clean interface that allows you to focus on what is really important.
Encharge has a feature that can help you save a lot of time: pre-designed flows for different scenarios.
Even if you don't want to use those flows, I recommend you to take a look at them because they can give you a lot of ideas.
Last but not least, the platform is very well documented, so if you have any doubts, there is probably an article that will solve them.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I think Encharge lacks a better integration with wordpress, one of the most popular CMS in the world.
It is really curious that an email marketing platform does not offer a form to collect emails in wordpress.
I know that Encharge's target customers are SAAS companies, but even taking this into account it seems to me that they could improve their integration with such widespread platforms as wordpress.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
If you're looking for an email marketing tool with advanced automation features, I think you could at least take a look at Encharge.
It is one of the few tools that represents a real alternative to other marketing automation tools like ActiveCampaign.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Currently I have created a flow in Encharge that allows me to do the onbording process to the new users of my website.
I also use Encharge to send weekly newsletters, although this is not the platform's strong point.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent newcomer alternative to active campaign or drip
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge has an excellent interface : simple, clear and fast, much better to my opinion than Active Campaign interface which is a bit too technical for the common mortal.
Creating a flow is easy and efficient.
Built in email validation system is a big plus and help to avoid using another app or software.
Email delivery seems good but I honestly haven't sent more than 1000 emails.
It is possible to produce personal emails with the Liquid langage used by Shopify and Drip. It's working well.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Encharge is still young and lacks integrations with more applications to compete with Active Campaign.
The interface is in English only. I know it can be a problem for some Frenchies (like me).
More options to personalize the email footer or the branding should be provided.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge helps me to easily segment my users to deliver more personalized content and adapt my marketing strategies depending on where in their journey are my potential customers.
A major time gain creating the flows and make them work.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Encharge?
review_question_answers.answer:
Encharge has an excellent interface : simple, clear and fast, much better to my opinion than Active Campaign interface which is a bit too technical for the common mortal.
Creating a flow is easy and efficient.
Built in email validation system is a big plus and help to avoid using another app or software.
Email delivery seems good but I honestly haven't sent more than 1000 emails.
It is possible to produce personal emails with the Liquid langage used by Shopify and Drip. It's working well.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Encharge?
review_question_answers.answer:
Encharge is still young and lacks integrations with more applications to compete with Active Campaign.
The interface is in English only. I know it can be a problem for some Frenchies (like me).
More options to personalize the email footer or the branding should be provided.

Encharge helps me to easily segment my users to deliver more personalized content and adapt my marketing strategies depending on where in their journey are my potential customers.
A major time gain creating the flows and make them work.

all_reviews.review_title: Not a lot of good things to say about email tools that aren't tried and tested but....
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The UI is clean and extremely easy to use. Coming from ActiveCampaign as our daily driver, I don't feel at all lost. As I said, very well thought out. Automation, taggging, and segmentations are all there and really powerful even thoug the company is still young-ish. Other email tools seem to be focused solely on newletters, while Encharge is focused on the right place - email automations.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The only few downsides (for now) is they don't yet have native eCommerce integrations with Shopify or WooComm. You can still setup a proper system if you used integrators like Zapier or Integromat, but a native integration would be awesome. I would also LOVE to see them allow us to use our own SMTP so we can pair it with mail warming tools to improve our deliverability (I HATE that ActiveCampaign doesn't allow that).

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Saving me some money from a very expensive ActiveCampaign subscription. I always love it when a new company comes along to take on the big boys. While it can't completely overthrow AC, I love that it's powerful enough to use on my projects that have not been too integrated into AC

all_reviews.review_title: Great Automation and Email Marketing App For Small Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I love having so many native integrations right within the app for other tools that we use on a regular basis. It's really great to not have to use 3rd party integration tools.
The user interface is great and easy to start building automation flows without getting overwhelmed with a steep learning curve.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
On the growth plan, it is a bit disappointing that transactional emails aren't included. I also wish there was a native integration with Shopify, but I believe they might be developing it in the future.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am using Encharge to automate tasks which reduces the amount of time I need to spend doing these things by hand. It also saves me money as I don't have to hire an assistant to do these kinds of things by hand. We're also using Encharge for our email marketing and nurture campaigns to help us stay top of mind with our followers.

all_reviews.review_title: Finally an Email Program for Sub Accounts!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Multiple Clients in one email automation account! As an agency, that is gold. Also, the ability to do broadcasts or workflows with templates makes it really easy to jump between my different email needs. This platform talks you through it every step of the way and is really easy to figure out.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I wish it had e-commerce (specifically Shopify & Woocommerce) integration.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Encharge would replace your normal email delivery marketing program such as MailChimp or MailPoet.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
It has been very easy to set up not just my main account but all of my client subaccounts. Switching between them is also effortless. The Site verification method is not only easy but it totally talked me through any issues.

The ability to manage all subaccounts in one place with some pretty awesome out of the box features.

The cost and the features were more beneficial than I could ignore.

A clean, simple and beautiful interface. Everything is in its expected place and the learning curve is little to none. Coming from other more complicated services, that's a big plus, because I'm not missing any function.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I can't think of anything I really dislike now. Perhaps it was a little underdeveloped in the beginning, and the knowledge base missed some minor stuff, but it's growing and becoming better.

My other automation service was charging me more and more, and Encharge came to the rescue. It does everything my old service did, and a bit more. It is even easier to create my flows to ensure everything goes the way I want. Importing contacts was a breeze, and I barely needed help in most of the tasks. Encharge will surely boost my business... at a reasonable price.

all_reviews.review_content:

Encharge is a rising star in the world of email marketing. I'm a big fan of their ever-increasing list of features, excellent support, easy-to-understand interface, and the incredible Flow Builder.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I don't have any real complaints about Encharge. Increasing the number of direct integrations they provide will make the Flow Builder more powerful. Since they're already doing this, I'm happy with their current trajectory!

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
I recommend giving Encharge a trial. It caters to businesses of all sizes and will likely influence your approach to Email Marketing for the better.

Email Marketing with Encharge is an absolute breeze. Previously, I had only been sending Newsletters to my audience, but I now have the option to automate this whole process with Encharge's Flow Builder. Most importantly, their powerful segmentation options enable you to create highly personalized email marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple & promising marketing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Great marketing automation tool. But you can also use it for 'regular' newsletters (broadcast). It also has special features like website tracking and lead scoring, which makes Encharge a really good choice for email marketing.
It has a great tracking feature with a lot of possibilities (I keep discovering new ones). Easy to set up / integrate.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I'm missing some e-commerce integrations. At the moment I use Zapier or webhooks for that. I had hoped that you could create 'templates' that can be used as a basis for all your emails (and can be centrally managed).

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge solves the automation, segmentation and personalization challenges. There is a sub-account function for agency clients with separate tracking script and account management.
It also has an automatic email validation feature for subscriber opt-ins, which saves time and money.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely versatile email marketing platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The drag-and-drop builder is one of the most intuitive and user-friendly features, which made it easy for me to find my way around in just a few minutes. The ability to easily create automated workflows with third-party tools also helped win me over - allowing me to not only manage newsletters but also run numerous automations. Although the interface is very simple and easy to use, it packs in a lot of extra functionality not found on other tools - segmentation, behavior-based actions and ad retargeting, to name a few. One of the things I love the most is the ability to check what actions my subscribers have taken - i.e. see when they have opened emails, clicked on links and purchased products all within a single view

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Honestly, there's not much to dislike. Although they already have a lot of integrations, I'm looking forward to them adding more.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Take the time to go through the tutorials and documentation - I found them incredibly helpful to orientate myself

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge allows me to really customize and personalize the user journey for my new customers, as well as integrating with my current tech stack - i.e. lead magnet capture forms, CRM and so forth

This feature is uncommon in other email marketing platforms, including the famous ones.

all_reviews.review_title: Love the way it handles automations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The two biggest things I like about Encharge are:

First is its automation capabilities. They rival those of its biggest competitors plus the added advantage of a flexible visual builder.
The builder allows for complex automations to be built in the same flow, instead of needing to stitch multiple separate ones together (because of triggers for example).

The second is that it uses segments and events for the automations. This is a much better system than "list" based ones and it makes things a lot easier to set up as contacts and freely and easily enter and exit flows as they meet criteria.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Haven't come across anything I dislike as of yet but if I had to point anything out, it would be the number of native integrations.  My setup works out of the box with Encharge but I could see others needing additional software like Zapier to connect everything.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
All manners of automations. It's fantastic for advanced follow-up systems for example.

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge - marketing on autopilot!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge isn't my first attempt into marketing automation, but it is my most successful one.

Ease of use:
Encharge is super easy to use. The UI is intuitive and easy to navigate. Creating a flow is easy as 1 2 3. Select triggers, setup an e-mail flow and you're ready to go. Oh and why not add the new subscribter to the facebook audience while we're on the go?

Possibilities:
- Setup smart flows that will save tons of work and are very easy to create using the blocks.
- Creating beautiful e-mails or newsletters have never been easier. It's all drag and drop, slickly built and with a professional look and feel.
- It's possible to A/B test
- Verification of email is built-in.
- I can finally target my emails to the write audience and make them more personal using tags!
- You can see the actions of each user with the unmissable user profiles.
And there are many other options like lead scoring and segmentation.

I haven't discovered and used all of the functionality yet, but I'm thrilled to use it and have a professional marketing automation system that is easy to use and does it's job.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There's not much I dislike. I wish it would be possible to save my login credentials, so I don't have to login every time. Another thing, but that's probably a matter of time, is that integration isn't available yet everywhere. However, with all the options available, you can integrate it with almost anything using Webhooks for example!

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've been able to setup a flow for my new subscribers that feels natural and saves a lot of time.
I feel like I can give everyone the personal attention they deserve. I can also segmentize my audience and send out different newsletters to different audiences with ease.

all_reviews.review_title: Nice MAS tool to replace almost any other
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I totally love how easy it is to use the tool.

Encharge has an extensive library of pre-created data fields, so rarely a new user has to spend time on drafting their own data points.

Of course you should pay attention to the extra data that you need but Encharge is already quite extensive on this side.

Also! The marketing automation flows are super. That I can't highlight enough, as it's intuitive to use and holds great potential because Encharge has very good contact segmentation tools.

These are the main benefits that got me to get the tool for myself. To use it heavily in my marketing and sales activities.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Something I'd love to see this tool have is the ability to collect company level data as a totally separate data set. So it wouldn't be tied to the individual people who I've registered. This is because as a practicioner of Account-Based marketing and sales, I see a huge value in being able to enrich your MAS and CRM systems with that kind of data and to analysis on that data!

That being said, I still got the tool even so that I'd love to see more "Account-Based" company level functionalities and CRM capabilities in the tool.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation is the big thing that I got Encharge for!

all_reviews.review_title: The go-to marketing automation tool for any scaling business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Choosing a marketing automation tool needs a lot of thought. I've tried a bunch before selecting Encharge, and haven't been happy with the alternatives. The main criteria for me have been integrations, affordability, functionality, scalability, and, most importantly, user experience.

To get full use out of a tool, I need to feel motivated to use it. Most alternatives I tried were a bit clunky and lacking support. I'm extremely happy with Encharge and the videos/tutorials etc make it feel like they've always got your back. The UI is also extremely intuitive and clean.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Native Woocommerce integration would unlock a ton of potential. Currently, this requires some workarounds or setting up webhooks.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
A single view of all customer touchpoints, and ability to personalise the marketing experience based on user behaviour/actions.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Growing Option for Email & CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I like how intuitive the interface is. As a general matter, the user experience is smooth, with options easy to find. When I'm not sure how to do something, I can play with it and figure it out often, but when that doesn't work or I'm in a hurry, the user guide information is helpful. I also find the whole thing much, much easier to learn and understand than I had expected!

What do you dislike about Encharge?
It is newer, and there is a learning curve. I think that the learning curve is probably similar amongst similar options, but I was able to use it at a basic level fairly quickly.  With it being newer, you get the benefit of an excited company listening to user input and making adjustments and additions.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I needed a good, reliable, easy to use email management for my CRM option, and I found my solution here. It's quicker and easier to use than I expected. I love the way to view the automations and ease with which I can view things. While I'm still newer in terms of using it, I can see how much time and energy this will save me - and with a much better quality, consistent, and scalable result! I'm excited to continue using it, have it grow with us, and see where it goes (and helps us go) from here.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Product!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
After trying Encharge, here are my top six reasons on why Encharge deserves five tacos. First, it is a huge time saver because of automation.  Second, it gives you awareness or insights about your marketing activities.  The third is the built-in email validation.  Fourth it integrates with other major apps.  Fifth is the easy-to-use user interface. And last is it has good documentation. Also A/B testing is coming.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I only wish that SyncSpider, BotStar, and WooCommerce will integrate with Encharge soon.  Also broadcasting speed needs to improve as I find it a bit slow broadcasting even with only two subscribers.

Nevertheless, I recommend this must-buy product.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
I highly recommend this product.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation and awareness.  It saves me considerable time.

all_reviews.review_title: Actually comparable to ActiveCampaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge is a dream if you need to create automations for your email lists. I was previously using a cobbled-together combo of Mailchimp, MailPoet, and INBOX, but none of those platforms offers the type or degree of automations I need for my e-commerce business. With Encharge, you can truly build the exact kind of flow you need, from lead nurturing to downloads to sales to event signups.

The UX/UI is clean and intuitive. The drag-and-drop builder works very smoothly. Importing contacts is easy, and it validates the emails as soon as you upload them -- this saved me from subscribing to a different platform I had been eyeing for this exact purpose. I was able to quickly import my list of contacts via CSV and auto-map/add tags as well.

Encharge integrates with both Zapier and Integrately (awesome!) and has webhooks. It also integrates with Elementor, which works well for my purposes -- no need to use a different form creator on my website to generate leads and bring them into Encharge.

I've been looking for a tool like this for a long time. Don't miss this one.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The only downside I've seen so far is that there are no lists, but you can use tags.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was able to replace my existing email platforms. Now I don't need to move to ActiveCampaign.

all_reviews.review_title: Great alternative for Klaviyo (Waiting  for ecommerce integration)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I was on the hunt for an affordable behavioral-based email marketing tool for a quite long time and luckily. Encharge was my one-stop solution. This is one of the investments in software tools that I have ever done.
The onboarding process is super simple with topnotch UI, User friendly, Drag and Drop features. It has a built-in email address verification which helps in boosting the deliverability and to maintain sender reputation. And it has access to 50+ native integration tools like zapier, slack, stripe, Mailchimp, Calendly, Hubspot, and much more, this actually makes the integration process super simple.
And I believe that it is going to be the best replacement for Klaviyo if they launch the e-commerce integration(Mainly Shopify). Eagerly waiting for Shopify integration.

pros:
- Great UI/UX experience
- Easy Flows creation
- No net for SMTP setup
- Affordable

all_reviews.review_title: The best alternative to Active Campaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
It is very simple.  Encharge is intuitive.  It is easy to plan any email automation in it.  It reminds me of Active Campaign.

Flow works fantastically.  You can easily plan a lot of marketing automation, eg. When someone fills in our landing form with their name, e-mail and phone number: they will receive several predefined tags, at the same time they will be added to the appropriate segment, they will receive an SMS to their phone number and their first email.  This person will also be added to the newly created Facebook segment to be able to target them with advertisements.  Everything automatically.  Without our participation.  It was enough to plan everything once and it still works thanks to Encharge.  There can be an infinite number of such automation.

Working on lists of people in the email database works great.  You can create new segments of people very accurately, e.g. leads from the last 7 days, people who were present at the last webinar, the most active subscribers.  You can analyze who has entered my website.  Who read the e-mails and clicked on the link in it.  Integration with various apps works, for example Stripe and Twilio.

Great product.  I recommend!

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Encharge is great.  However, it is a young product.  It must be borne in mind that there is no 24/7 support here.  Sometimes you have to wait for a reply.  However, they have fantastic tutorials that make it easy to understand how simple it all works.  I recommend starting with them.  There are text and video instructions.  I would also like the Encharge team to focus more on clients from the European Union.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge showed me that automated marketing can be simple.  It can be available to small businesses with one-man activities or in small teams of people.  Encharge has proved that it is possible to create a product that is simple to use and at the same time has powerful possibilities.  Thanks to the creation of many automation at Encharge, I have more time.  I can spend it with my family or use it for activities that cannot be automated yet.  But it's probably a matter of time

I miss the prebuilt email templates, if in future that can also be added it would be very convenient for users

Sending automated behavior based emails, which saves time and money.

all_reviews.review_title: An easy to use, cost-effective and feature rich email marketing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I have been using encharge for quite a while now and here are the things i liked the most about it
1. I loved the easy to use flow builder and email builder
2. There are a lot of integrations available which makes the job really easy
3. The pre-built flows are also really helpful
4. The support is also really fast and helpful.
5. The concept of segments is new to me as i am used to lists but it is also quite helpful.
6. They also have built in email validation feature due to which i need not used any other software for email validation.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Though things are mostly good, it would have been good if there were some more integrations like integromat etc. I see some small features missing like buld email delete etc. However, on contacting the support, they told that the features will be added soon.

So, I am looking forward for those additions as well and looking forward to build super amazing flows and generate more business.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Flow building is easy now
2. Due to a lot of integrations, email marketing has become easy for me
3. Moreover, the cost is also less comparatively which is a big problem solver for me

all_reviews.review_title: Promising & delivering
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Tags, Flows, Triggers, Custom user fields, Thrivecart integration through Pabbly. Last but not last - support: very friendly and fast.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I won't call it dislike, yet there are some things that should be done. Like ability to delete things like tags, emails, not only archive them.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
I recommend it, it is feature rich service with many integrations already done and with  Zapier, Pabbly, Integrately etc probably alamost anything can be connected.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was looking for such service for a while - mainly to be able to use it with Thrivecart. And although there is no native Thrivecart-Encharge integration yet, I found out I can do it with Pabbly (a Zapier alternative). It works and it rocks. I suggest watching some Pabbly - Thrivecart integration video tutorial first and than it is really easy to connect Encharge. I can tell you that Encharge is already pretty ,,charged" - it is possible to create custom fields - so again for me it is very helpful as I use labels in Thrivecart which can be transfered to Encharge. Not only you can import data to Encharge as regular data to tabs/sheets (import them to rows and columns), you can import them as TAGS! Encharge works a bit differently than other such services I know. You do not have "lists", but people (nice :) and by tagging people you can create segments. Very handy.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Builder for Customer-Journeys!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
- Great usability
- Create complex User-Journeys and not only Follow-Up-Mailings
- Good integrations and growing

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There are some small lacking features that are on the roadmap.
I definitely miss a good and deep Pipedrive-Integration but I guess it will be published this year.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Since AutopilotHQ nearly doubled theire prices about two years ago I am looking for an alternative, but Encharge.io is the first software that plays in the same league.

There are lots of services for Follow-Up-Mailings like Customerly or Cold-Outreach like Snov.io, but nothing that can build a whole Customer-Journey. The onliest one I found so far was Automizy, but Automizy lacks on integrations (so far).

Encharge is great in all parts I have tested so far:
- Many integrations (really deep Pipedrive-Integrations is also on the roadmap)
- Delivery-Rate
- Usability
- Limits
- Fair price

There are only tiny things that I hope will be done someday. I would love to see the integration of an own SMTP-Server (they are open for it, but they didn't have many requests) and the handling of deleted contacts (they call it "archived" but you can't clean the archive). But nothing major missing.

Only the Pipedrive-Integration (and maybe a Google-Contacts-Sync) would be the ice on the topping!

Allt he best, Julian!

all_reviews.review_title: Looks like what I've been waiting for
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I'm fairly new to using autoresponders but I knew I wanted the use of tagging. I gave this a whirl and was really pleased at the tagging facility. I can now segment my subscribers to various lists depending on their actions.

It was also really easy to use, most autoresponders are a learning curve at best but I created my first campaign and sent an email all without looking at any tutorials. I'm excited what I can achieve when I learn more about the platform.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
At the moment there is no form integration (although this is on the roadmap) so I had to sign up to a separate platform to create a form to embed it on my website. But this was all straight forward which even I managed so not such a problem. Will look forward to when this is implemented.

All in all I am really happy with Encharge and will hopefully be a customer for a long time. Great work guys.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Yes I recommend using Encharge.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
As mentioned above, the tagging is a real gem for me.

all_reviews.review_title: Muy buena e intuitiva
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge tiene una interfaz excelente: simple, clara y rapida, mucho mejor en mi opinion que la interfaz de Active Campaign, que es un poco demasiado tecnica para el mortal comun.
Crear un flujo es facil y eficiente.
El sistema de validacion de correo electronico incorporado es una gran ventaja y ayuda a evitar el uso de otra aplicacion o software.
La entrega de correo electronico parece buena, pero sinceramente no he enviado mas de 1000 correos electronicos.
Es posible producir correos electronicos personales con el lenguaje Liquid utilizado por Shopify y Drip. Funciona bien.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Sin embargo, Encharge aun es joven y carece de integraciones con mas aplicaciones para competir con Active Campaign.
La interfaz solo esta en ingles. Se que puede ser un problema para algunos franceses (como yo).
Se deben proporcionar mas opciones para personalizar el pie de pagina del correo electronico o la marca.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Muy recomendado

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email a precio accesible y secuencias avanzadas

all_reviews.review_title: Polished and easy-to-learn product for newbies like me
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
This is actually my first time to purchase an email marketing automation tool and, luckily, I bumped into this while I was searching for other tools like Automizy and ActiveCampaign. I thought that the UI/UX of it is on-point! Also, I find Encharge to have the ease of use especially for beginners like me. One of my favorite integrations is the connection with WP Fluent Forms. That's an awesome combo for me! Not only that Fluent Forms is available in the integration but Encharge offers a lot more integration than you expect.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Feature Request: I really would love to have an integration for WooCommerce, Shopify and, and also, SMTP our own emails sending. Hopefully, Encharge users will be able to see these in the coming days or weeks.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Look at the integrations and you'll surely be blown out with Encharge!

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
After reviewing this, I thought this is more than enough for me already especially for my needs to simply send out newsletters to my subscribers. I am also planning to use this for my clients to help them with their automations.

all_reviews.review_title: Great so far!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I'll admit, I'm a huge MailerLite fan and wasn't quite sure how Encharge would compare; however, I thought I'd give it a shot given the features! So far, I'm quite impressed. Set up was easy (even for a novice like me who until a year ago thought a cpanel was bloodwork your doctor orders for you...lol). I'm a SUPER visual person and LOVE the branch logic framework. The emails are awesome, and they're adding more. I honestly cannot see what Encharge can do that MailerLite cannot! I plan to import my list and start diving in deeper this weekend, but at first glance, it seems easy to use and a very powerful platform.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Bit of a learning curve but not too steep

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I like the automation features. Seems a very robust tool that will help me connect to my list.

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge has powerful marketing automation features along with great UI, templates and support.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I love how easy it is to use the software, even with all of the powerful features offered. I've been using ActiveCampaign for a while now, but have been searching for an alternative with better features and UI. I tried everything and was going to pull the trigger on AutoPilot, but couldn't justify the hefty pricing. The search has finally come to an end after testing out Encharge. This is it - The features are there, the automation flow builder is powerful and easy to use, and there are some awesome templates to get you started with sending out behavior-based emails right away.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I wish they would have an integration with Twilio to send out text messages from my campaigns. I did see that it's on the roadmap so I hope this comes out soon. It would be a game-changer!

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Encharge for email marketing that's automated and behavior-based from a cost-effective, yet powerful tool. I can already see how this is going to improve my email marketing efforts. The templates included are great and some quick wins to improve your overall marketing efforts. Excited to see how the tool progresses!

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge Is Serious Competition For ActiveCampaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I love the simplicity of the drag and drop flow builder in Encharge. This makes the set up process really easy and can have operational automations in no time.

What I also really appreciate is the vast number of native integrations available for Encharge. It connects with so many other mainstream products that this will ensure compatibility with my current software ecosystem.  And for others the connectivity with Zapier and Pabbly etc adds additional integrations on top.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
So far I have not found anything that I am dissatisfied with during the early stage of use of Encharge.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
If you appreciate clean UI and simply functionality and ease of use, this is a great automated email marketing software.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
The most important problem is removing the time demanding email marketing processes I have previously been committed to. With automation, this software is saving me hours each week.

all_reviews.review_title: Good New Comer that has a lot of potential and new ideas.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge's UI is clean and easy to use. The drag-and-drop builder works great. Importing contacts is easy.

Encharge has integrations with both Zapier and Integrately (a must nowadays) and has webhooks (also a must nowadays).

The visual builders are easy to follow and if you are familiar with business process charts, you will learn it in no time.

There is a lot of demos and onboarding videos.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
1. There are no lists
2.  Unable to auto-map/add tags using the CSV import at the moment
3. I wish they would make more native integrations. Zapier and Integrately definitely overcharge for simple use cases and having this native integration would save us a ton of money and help pay for better plans :)

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
User segmentation which I could not do with send fox and Mailchimp effectively. Additionally, the UI interface helps me see the flow easily.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Builder of Emails and Automations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
What I really like most of all is the email builder.  I'm been using ActiveCampaign for nearly 7 years and have been completely frustrated with the email builder and how out of date it is.  Switching to Encharge felt a little like Christmas Morning. Additionally, I enjoy how they have laid out the Automations flow, it's not nearly as rigid and clunky as AC.

So far so good.  I'll be spending quite a few hours transferring everything over to Encharge, fingers crossed.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The software is new, so I anticipate changes and updates.  For now, though, I feel the UI isn't as quick and accessible as I'd like.  I can't really search for things, I have to scroll for things when building emails and automation.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Finding an email marketing platform that's user-friendly and worthy of being shared with friends with low tech skills.

all_reviews.review_title: Good email sequence automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I use Encharge like Mailchimp to collect emails with a form on my website.
Like Active Campaign, Encharge allows me to create effective email campaigns and automate marketing tasks.
Where Encharge is more powerful is that it allows me to send emails based on what people are doing or not doing on my site.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
I look forward to a native integration for Woocommerce which I use a lot. This would make the tool even more efficient. There is also no native integration for Shopify yet. You can't send cold emails, but that wasn't my goal.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Avoid too big email lists.
No cold emails

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Segment users into personalized email campaigns based on their behavior and how they interact with my product

all_reviews.review_title: Encharge - impressive integrations, responsive customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The wide range of integrations with third party applications, either direction, or via Zapier, or web hooks.  Customer support is also very responsive, they answer my queries very quickly, better than most SAAS companies.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
They are still in rapid growth phase, so the possibility of bugs occurring is higher vs more established offerings. On the plus side though, they are also more likely to fix these issues more quickly than more established platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
Compare Encharge to ActiveCampaign, in terms of pricing, functionality, and responsiveness to customer support.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Encharge is providing a lower cost email automation platform without giving up functionality.  It allows me to keep in touch with current clients, as well as nurture prospective clients.
