all_reviews.review_title: One of the best ESP
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Awesome ESP. It has all you need to ensure your business takes off without the price tag of some other tools. Its comprehensive amount of features and integrations makes this tool the last one you'll try because you'll want to stick with it. I personally use the behavior marketing automations as these are sent at just the right time. Also, the site tracking and events make it easy to send the right email to the right person. Lastly, their integrations with the big players in automation, Zapier, Pabbly Connect and Integrately, makes it easy to integrate any tool that doesn't currently have any native integration.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
As this is a fairly new tool, there are some missing native integrations (WooCommerce, Shopify). Also, some automations aren't present at this moment. Overall, fairly complete.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing for my startup

all_reviews.review_title: Email marketing automation at its best
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
What I like best is that I think it is fully GDPR comiplant without internacional transfer of data, it has behavourial tracking to trigger email campaings, and I like the editor for creating ecommerce emails newsletters.  It also checks that emails are valid, and has a quite complete person profiles with tagging. And it is a very dynamic took with nice usability. It is good that it has interesting integrations (facebook ads, pabbly, stripe, etc). Also the activity stream feature is good to know what is going on on real time.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
At the time of writing this (April 2021) some features are still not completelly ready. Missing specially the web forms.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing with triggers in the welcome sequence, and regular newsletters being GDPR compilant without international transfers.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful, delightful to use, next generation email & marketing automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Where do I even start?

I've used email marketing platforms - Mailchimp, ConvertKit, MailerLite.

Mailchimp is probably the most well known, really because they were the first to have a free tier and captured mind share. It's basic, and is frustrating to use if you want to do anything more than the basics.
ConverKit was aimed at bloggers and does have a simpler to use geared at email sequences (which I like), but if you want to do multiple pathways, if/or conditions, it isn't equipped to do so.
MailerLite is quite decent, but not as powerful as Encharge.

1) Powerful "Flows" - very customizable flows which allows one to have multiple conditions, parallel pathways, allow multiple or single sends.

2) Powerful integrations - this is the secret sauce of Encharge, and why it's the next generation tool in my mind. It integrates with external tools like Hubspot CRM, Facebook Custom Audiences. It becomes your marketing automation stack, which is what I really dreamt of. While more integrations are coming on that are on my wish list, this is really what I want to invest in.

3) Advanced Segmentation & easy Tagging: As part of flows, it's easier to tag users, recognizing which form or opt in they came from, which campaign they are tied to, what downloads they did, what pages they landed on. Combined with segments, one can send out tailored messages.

4) Onboarding: I'm impressed by the onboarding emails received to really get one up to speed. This is an advanced tool, and it's really important to get users acquainted with the features. That being said, the user experience is really easy once you know what to look for.

I'll advise users to think about their marketing flow, before creating them in Encharge.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Much to like. Below are my wishlist for improvements:

1. Google sheets integration: Not only just to add users, but adding of attributes to existing users in Encharge. For example, I may have many subscribers, but I maintain a list of "paid customers" in Google Sheets, with different products bought, subscription period. I'll like to just update Google Sheets, and have this updated in google sheets.

2. Hubspot 2 way sync: on a similar thread, to have Encharge recognize all attributes from Hubspot, and not just email address, on a live refresh basis. If this is already available I apologize, but this will be a winner!

3. Other CRM integrations like SalesFlare

4. Opt In forms: HTML forms are on the way, but I'll like direct integration from various common tools like Thrive Architect for Wordpress, Brizy Cloud. Yes this is dependent on these 3rd party providers, but getting subscribers INTO Encharge is a key success criteria.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
TRUE email and marketing automation through advanced flows, tagging, segmentation. It's a huge relief from using dated tools like Mailchimp.

Visual FLOW builder allows me to really visualize and understand the whole flow. And it's all in one, instead of using a 3rd party flowchart tool to draw, and map out the flow through some obscure process like in other tools, this is truly the 1 tool that I need.

all_reviews.review_title: Making a Charge for ActiveCampaign
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
Encharge is one of the first viable alternatives to ActiveCampaign that I've come across. If you're looking to automate your emails into long and complex flows, then you've found it with Encharge. I've been using ActiveCampaign, exclusively, for years. There are 3 things I love about it: the ability to tag, segment, and blast emails based on behaviour; their simple-to-use drag-and-drop builder; and their deliverability rates.

Encharge definitely checks two of 2 of these 3 boxes. They have a great drag-and-drop builder with everything you need to customize the exact look of your emails. Plus, they have a flow builder that has more integrations and just as many (if not more) possibilities as ActiveCampaign's automation builder.

Using the app is intuitive and easy to learn. It looks great too!

Encharge looks to be making a charge for ActiveCampaign in the email automation space. Their support is amazing, even better than what you get with ActiveCampaign. As long as their emails keep hitting the inbox, I'll be moving myself, my clients, and all of my future clients from ActiveCampaign to Encharge.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
There are some things I hope they'll add to stay on par with--and one day surpass--ActiveCampaign. Adding the ability to copy multiple steps of a flow would be great, and it sounds like they're working on it already. Being able to move users stuck at a step into another step manually would be very helpful. Finally, SMS is a must to truly compete with ActiveCampaing. So far, their pricing is only slightly less than ActiveCampaign's--I hope it's enough to sway current AC users to try something new.

Now, Encharge checks 2 of the 3 boxes mentioned earlier, but their deliverability is still an unknown. Some of their onboarding emails were going straight to my junk/spam folder. This is a particular issue for Microsoft receiving accounts like Hotmail or Outlook. I know ActiveCampaign has had issues with this, but they were always quick to find a fix. Encharge said they were working on it, and ever since, their emails have been hitting my inbox! This is crucial. Without high deliverability rates, the platform will fail. So, I hope they make this a major, ongoing priority.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email Automation at a competitive price

all_reviews.review_title: Great alternative to my Mailchimp account
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The process of creating an email is very similar to Mailchimp. You select your segment, create or select an email, choose if you need to create A/B testing and send or scheduled your sending.
If you come from Mailchimp you'll have no trouble understanding the process.
They have a support for RTL language.

I like the built-in email validation.

The onboarding is very clear and the Help section has many articles.
The support is very responsive. The way to communicate with the support is via chat or email.
I got my answers by mail after few minutes during the weekend.

Automate tasks help me to reduces the amount of time I need to spend doing manually.

Before you start sendin emails in the system you need to validate account by reply to an email and add cname and txt records in your domain hosting.

Although the app is young comparing to other players in the market, they managed to achieved a solid app with many features.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
The app is young comparing to other players in the market like activecampaign  and mailchimp. Some integrations are on the way such as Integromat and Pipedrive.

Recommendations to others considering Encharge:
I would recommend to test this product and compare it with the main players in the market. I'm sure you won't regret.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a mailchimp's customer I didn't have the ability to use automation. In Encharge the automation processes save me time.

all_reviews.review_title: Great software many features that are easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
I like the speed of the platform best plus the automation features and commitment to add features soon.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
It doesn't have RSS feeds yet.  I need automated RSS feeds to help send newsletters better.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation, sales and email newsletter automation.

all_reviews.review_title: So slick
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Encharge?
The UI/UX is killer. Very intuitive and easy to get up and running.

What do you dislike about Encharge?
Unfortunately they haven't focused on ecommerce. Best for SAAS (for now). Hopefully they will add Shopify etc.

What problems is Encharge solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer journey mgmt. Very similar to AutopilotHQ. As opposed to just newsletter automation.
